meanings.definition: A feeling of smug or uncritical satisfaction with oneself or one's achievements.
meanings.sent1: His complacency after winning the game was evident in his smug smile.
meanings.sent2: She was filled with complacency as she admired her completed artwork.
meanings.sent3: The cat's complacency in knocking over the vase was amusingly oblivious.
meanings.sent4: The complacency of the old tree's roots led to its downfall in the storm.
meanings.sent5: The complacency of the students studying for the easy test was shattered when they saw the difficult questions.

meanings.definition: A feeling of quiet pleasure or security, often while unaware of some potential danger or defect.
meanings.sent1: The hiker's complacency in the peaceful forest was shattered by the sudden growl of a bear.
meanings.sent2: She enjoyed the complacency of her cozy home on a rainy day.
meanings.sent3: The complacency of the sleepy guard allowed the mischievous raccoon to sneak past.
meanings.sent4: The complacency of the ship's crew led to disaster when they sailed into the storm.
meanings.sent5: The complacency of the town was shattered when they discovered a hidden sinkhole beneath the main street.
